title: Lost connection due to resizing the window
author: Phyllo
body_snippet:
I searched issues to see if I find it reported already but I did not, only something similar and one answer there was:
"I guess this is by design. mRemoteNG reconnects to the host in order to set the resolution to the changed window size."

I guess this applies to my problem, too but I still find it very annoying, so I open a new issue to hear what other think of it:

When I am connected to another computer and then resize the window, it always loses the connection and it takes a couple of ...

Not a solution, but you can disable the resizing.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6205123/135066906-dc2d0fd3-2755-44c2-9011-0da9113ebd21.png)
Maybe this helps as a workaround.
comments.author: LIyoai

comments.snippet: Thanks, I'll give that a try but a real solution would be better if someone finds the time to implement it.
comments.author: Phyllo

comments.snippet: This is a limitation of RDP and not mRemoteNG. The window size correlates to the resolution used for the remote session. RDP enforces that it's established during the connection. A change to the window size means the connection needs to be reestablished to update the remote resolution. There's nothing mRemoteNG could do to work around it.

comments.author: howartp84

comments.snippet:
@bfriedman-od 
Although this does stop the crashing from happening it should be noted that the resolution will not auto scale when turning this on, it "smart scales" which means it will keep the same resolution and just squish and screech the screen. The benefit is, the screen wont crash when resizing. However if you want the new resolution after adjustment of the screen you will need to disconnect and reconnect each time.
